intro: Cenia turbinata, commonly known as the turbinated cenia, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its distinctive, turbinated (spiral-shaped) leaves and showy, trumpet-like flowers that range in color from white to pink. It thrives in tropical and subtropical climates, often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and as a landscape plant.
